result.execSummary:
The defendant Destiny Renee Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with J.I.W.
No possession of firearms unless in a safety arms safety course.

Absolute sobriety with random testing.
Complete a firearms safety course. 
Court further ordered that parties can submit an order for early termination of probation once a firearm safety course is completed.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 10/5/2023 or to convert to a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destiny Renee Webb

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Destiny Renee Webb in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Destiny Renee Webb.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, straight time with credit for 1 day time served.
Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on 8 months probation.
Conditions of probation are:
- no contact with JIW
- absolute sobriety with random testing
- no possession of firearms unless in a safety arms safety course
- complete a firearms safety course
Court further ordered that parties can submit an order for early termination of probation once a firearms safety course is completed. 

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

Court waived all non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  Mandatory costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 10-5-2023, to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given

Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Destiny Renee Webb in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Destiny Renee Webb.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.
Defense informed the Court that this case is in resolution posture and requests a projected plea/sentencing hearing.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 13.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Destiny Renee Webb in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Destiny Renee Webb appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time. Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Destiny Renee Webb in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Destiny Renee Webb appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/20/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Destiny Renee Webb in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@2:30pm
